title: Gear S3 On iPhone: Just Get An Apple Watch
description: Smartwatches arent in a great place right now. Android Wear is stalled pending its big 2.0 update; Apple still wont break out sales figures for its own Watch; and Fitbit is buying every boutique smartwatch company it can get its hands on. So when Samsung announced that its Gear S3 was finally ready to be used with the iPhone, I was stoked that maybe an Apple Watch competitor had finally arrived for iOS. I probably should have known better.   [SUBSCRIBE]     [ABOUT THIS VIDEO]  MrMobile's Gear S3 on iPhone video was produced following four days usage of a Samsung Gear S3 Frontier (AT&T edition) paired with an Apple iPhone 7. transcript: - [Michael] Smart watches aren't in a great place right now. Android Wear is stalled, pending a coming update. Apple still won't break out sales figures for its own watch. And all those boutique alternatives that were so cool? Apparently they're all getting bought by Fitbit. So, when Samsung announced that its Gear S3 was finally ready to be used with iOS, I was stoked that maybe an Apple Watch competitor had finally arrived for the iPhone. I probably should have known better. (dramatic synth music) I don't mean to say that the Gear S3 has nothing going for it on the iPhone. It's got plenty. It's rated for a wider range of temperatures and it can handle more abuse, for one thing. And though it's much larger than the Apple Watch, I prefer its look, with its always-on display and easier to use app launcher. It also uses standard 22 mm connections, so you can bring your own watchbands. And depending on which version you get, it'll last as long or longer than the Apple Watch on a single charge. Most of the problems with the Gear S3 on iPhone aren't Samsung's fault. Rather, they're effects of the stringent control Apple exerts over its ecosystem. Mobile payments are a great example of this. When it's paired to an Android phone, the Gear S3 is a very convenient way to pay for things. Even more convenient than the Apple Watch, because it'll work on any magnetic stripe reader. But, when it's paired to an iPhone, the Gear can't do payments at all because the Samsung Pay app just isn't there. For similar reasons, you can't buy new watch faces or apps for the watch, at press time. You need to stick to the free ones. Even super basic stuff, like the timer and stopwatch aren't included by default. You need to go download them from Samsung. Plus, you can't reply to notifications from your wrist like you can when you're paired to an Android phone. You can't even archive or dismiss emails. And the iOS version of the S Health fitness suite is definitely pared down compared to the version you can run on a Galaxy. Apple, I love you, but you're bringing me down. The Gear S3 does some things well on the iPhone. Once you get it set up properly, which requires you to pair the phone with two separate Bluetooth connections from the watch, it gives you prompt notifications on your wrist and of course they show up crisply on the beautiful display. On the whole, it's also snappier than the Apple Watch. It boots much faster and doesn't make you wait while it loads app, as the Apple product sometimes does. The Gear S3 also does well for phone calls. I carried on a half-hour conversation on it, and the caller couldn't tell I was using a watch until I told him. I wanted to title this video, "The Best Smartwatch for Your iPhone is a Samsung." You know, for the clicks. But it's just not true. (buzzing) Functionally, the Gear S3 is severely handicapped when you use it with the iPhone. Just like every other smart watch not designed in Cupertino. Also, Samsung's app ecosystem lags the Apple Watch by the thousands. And the starting prices for these watches are almost identical. So, if you have an Android phone and want an excellent and fully-featured wearable, by all means, get the Gear S3. If you've got an iPhone, though, do yourself a favor. Just get the Apple Watch. For a deeper dive on each of these smart watches, check out my full reviews on the Mr. Mobile YouTube channel and be sure to subscribe so you don't miss future videos on all things mobile tech. Till next time, thanks for watching. And stay mobile, my friends.
transcript_entity_values: The Best Smartwatch for Your iPhone
